Body:
What We've Learned Updated: The customer has the below question:

"
I just wanted to reach out today to see if you, or someone in your organization, could advise if there is a method within the Netwrix Endpoint Protector Appliance running version 5.9.4.0 for setting up an alert when a file hash on a file that is located on an internal hard drive is changed. At current we see many different alerts we can create, but don’t appear to see an option for a file hash modification. Additionally, with the File Hashes option enabled on the appliance, the only files we are seeing hashes generated for are those associated with a removable storage device, is it possible to have hashes generated for files located on Network Shares and internal storage?
"
We tried to enable file Hash from the Global Settings, but this did not return anything on the customer side when logs were generated.
Next Steps Updated: Waiting on R&D.

What We've Learned Updated: There is no available method to receive an alert when a file's hash is modified.

---
The customer has the below question:

"
I just wanted to reach out today to see if you, or someone in your organization, could advise if there is a method within the Netwrix Endpoint Protector Appliance running version 5.9.4.0 for setting up an alert when a file hash on a file that is located on an internal hard drive is changed. At current we see many different alerts we can create, but don’t appear to see an option for a file hash modification. Additionally, with the File Hashes option enabled on the appliance, the only files we are seeing hashes generated for are those associated with a removable storage device, is it possible to have hashes generated for files located on Network Shares and internal storage?
"
We tried to enable file Hash from the Global Settings, but this did not return anything on the customer side when logs were generated.

Next Steps Updated: 21Jan: Communicated to customer: there is no available method to receive an alert when a file's hash is modified. Asked if there is any other info we can provide.
---
Waiting on R&D.
